parameters.content: ## Automatically update all docker images on the server

## Custom Script for your Docker server

''bash
Processing hompage-compose.yaml
  GNU nano 7.2                                                                update-all-docker-compose.sh
#!/bin/bash
declare -A UPDATED_CONTAINERS
N8N_FILE="n8n-compose.yaml"  # Adjust to your n8n compose filename

for file in *-compose.yaml; do
  if [[ "$file" == "$N8N_FILE" ]]; then
    echo "Skipping $file (n8n instance)"
    continue
  fi

  echo "Processing $file"
  UPDATED_IMAGES=()

  OUTPUT=$(docker compose -f "$file" pull 2>&1)
  echo "$OUTPUT"

  while IFS= read -r line; do
    if [[ $line =~ "Downloaded newer image" ]]; then
      IMAGE=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
      UPDATED_IMAGES+=("$IMAGE: updated")
    elif [[ $line =~ "Image is up to date" ]]; then
      IMAGE=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
      UPDATED_IMAGES+=("$IMAGE: already up-to-date")
    fi
  done <<< "$OUTPUT"

  docker compose -f "$file" up -d

  UPDATED_CONTAINERS["$file"]=${UPDATED_IMAGES[@]:-none}
done

echo "Update Summary:"
echo "{"
for file in "${!UPDATED_CONTAINERS[@]}"; do
  echo "  \"$file\": ["
  for status in ${UPDATED_CONTAINERS[$file]}; do
    echo "    \"$status\","
  done
  echo "  ],"
done
echo "}"
''
